channel.title: Problem logging on [Shardes]~[CreativeScape]
channel.description:
It logs me, or any player off when you log in. When you make an account that isn't already created everything works, until you log off, and try to log on again.
An error message shows up on the runclient cmd. [code]Error: T2 - 97,126,126 - 2,0,0 - 103,72, urlstream[/code] I'm not posting this in client help because I believe this is something to do with the client not reading the server?

item.title: Problem logging on [Shardes]~[CreativeScape]
item.dc:creator: @Mr_x1 Mr...x..
item.description:
@Mr_x1 wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:4, topic:445375”][quote author=zadehogan link=topic=548074.msg4018671#msg4018671 date=1339853239]
Edit your i.p out of this bro.
[/quote]

Lmfao.

It logs me, or any player off when you log in.
When you make an account that isn’t already created everything works, until you log off, and try to log on again.

An error message shows up on the runclient cmd.

Error: T2 - 97,126,126 - 2,0,0 - 103,72, urlstream
I’m not posting this in client help because I believe this is something to do with the client not reading the server?

You’re sending packet 97 improperly.

Packet 97 is show interface packet, look to see if the id of your interface is too high, or if theres a null child or something.[/quote]
Yes I fixed the problem yesterday on my own. Thanks any though!

Read full topic

item.title: Problem logging on [Shardes]~[CreativeScape]
item.dc:creator: @zadehogan zadehogan
item.description:
@zadehogan wrote:

Sorry thought it was, just looking out for you.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem logging on [Shardes]~[CreativeScape]
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

zadehogan:

Edit your i.p out of this bro.

Lmfao.

[quote=“Mr…x…, post:1, topic:445375”]It logs me, or any player off when you log in.
When you make an account that isn’t already created everything works, until you log off, and try to log on again.

An error message shows up on the runclient cmd.

Error: T2 - 97,126,126 - 2,0,0 - 103,72, urlstream
I’m not posting this in client help because I believe this is something to do with the client not reading the server?[/quote]

You’re sending packet 97 improperly.

Packet 97 is show interface packet, look to see if the id of your interface is too high, or if theres a null child or something.

Read full topic
